channel.title: CVE Feed for McAfee,LLC -- McAfee ePolicy Orchestrator (ePO)
channel.description: The latest CVEs for McAfee,LLC -- McAfee ePolicy Orchestrator (ePO)

item.title: CVE-2021-23889|2024-08-03T19:14:09.155Z -- mcafee%2Cllc -- mcafee%20epolicy%20orchestrator%20%28epo%29
item.description: Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability in McAfee ePolicy Orchestrator (ePO) prior to 5.10 Update 10 allows ePO administrators to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via multiple parameters where the administrator's entries were not correctly sanitized.

item.title: CVE-2021-23888|2024-08-03T19:14:09.497Z -- mcafee%2Cllc -- mcafee%20epolicy%20orchestrator%20%28epo%29
item.description: Unvalidated client-side URL redirect vulnerability in McAfee ePolicy Orchestrator (ePO) prior to 5.10 Update 10 could cause an authenticated ePO user to load an untrusted site in an ePO iframe which could steal information from the authenticated user.

item.title: CVE-2021-23890|2024-08-03T19:14:09.188Z -- mcafee%2Cllc -- mcafee%20epolicy%20orchestrator%20%28epo%29
item.description: Information leak vulnerability in the Agent Handler of McAfee ePolicy Orchestrator (ePO) prior to 5.10 Update 10 allows an unauthenticated user to download McAfee product packages (specifically McAfee Agent) available in ePO repository and install them on their own machines to have it managed and then in turn get policy details from the ePO server. This can only happen when the ePO Agent Handler is installed in a Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) to service machines not connected to the network through a VPN.
